alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 11 at 4:56PM MST until June 11 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 600 PM MST. * At 454 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Deer Valley Airport to near Phoenix to Tolleson to near Liberty, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 127 and 153. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 218. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 15. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Scottsdale, Tempe, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Paradise Valley, Tolleson, Laveen, Cashion, Papago Park, Piestewa Peak Park, Deer Valley Airport and North Mountain Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
